body_html:
I haven't ported StridedSliceAssign to new variables yet, so now you should feed it the output of a VariableV2 op.
…
On Wed, Apr 19, 2017 at 4:48 PM, Anthony Platanios ***@***.*** > wrote: @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> Given that reference data types are going away, what input should I feed to ops such as StridedSliceAssign that have a Ref(T) input type? The op registration in the C++ code looks like this: REGISTER_OP("StridedSliceAssign") .Input("ref: Ref(T)") .Input("begin: Index") .Input("end: Index") .Input("strides: Index") .Input("value: T") .Output("output_ref: Ref(T)") .Attr("T: type") .Attr("Index: {int32, int64}") .Attr("begin_mask: int = 0") .Attr("end_mask: int = 0") .Attr("ellipsis_mask: int = 0") .Attr("new_axis_mask: int = 0") .Attr("shrink_axis_mask: int = 0") And similarly, what is the output data type of such an op? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#9150 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxT_876EI20PohW70qe6OGPMz6s1zks5rxp02gaJpZM4M6yMu> .
-- - Alex
body_text:
I haven't ported StridedSliceAssign to new variables yet, so now you should
feed it the output of a VariableV2 op.
…
On Wed, Apr 19, 2017 at 4:48 PM, Anthony Platanios ***@***.*** > wrote:
 @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> Given that reference data types are
 going away, what input should I feed to ops such as StridedSliceAssign
 that have a Ref(T) input type?

 The op registration in the C++ code looks like this:

 REGISTER_OP("StridedSliceAssign")
     .Input("ref: Ref(T)")
     .Input("begin: Index")
     .Input("end: Index")
     .Input("strides: Index")
     .Input("value: T")
     .Output("output_ref: Ref(T)")
     .Attr("T: type")
     .Attr("Index: {int32, int64}")
     .Attr("begin_mask: int = 0")
     .Attr("end_mask: int = 0")
     .Attr("ellipsis_mask: int = 0")
     .Attr("new_axis_mask: int = 0")
     .Attr("shrink_axis_mask: int = 0")

 And similarly, what is the output data type of such an op?

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#9150 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxT_876EI20PohW70qe6OGPMz6s1zks5rxp02gaJpZM4M6yMu>
 .


-- 
 - Alex
body:
I haven't ported StridedSliceAssign to new variables yet, so now you should
feed it the output of a VariableV2 op.

On Wed, Apr 19, 2017 at 4:48 PM, Anthony Platanios <notifications@github.com
> wrote:

> @alextp <https://github.com/alextp> Given that reference data types are
> going away, what input should I feed to ops such as StridedSliceAssign
> that have a Ref(T) input type?
>
> The op registration in the C++ code looks like this:
>
> REGISTER_OP("StridedSliceAssign")
>     .Input("ref: Ref(T)")
>     .Input("begin: Index")
>     .Input("end: Index")
>     .Input("strides: Index")
>     .Input("value: T")
>     .Output("output_ref: Ref(T)")
>     .Attr("T: type")
>     .Attr("Index: {int32, int64}")
>     .Attr("begin_mask: int = 0")
>     .Attr("end_mask: int = 0")
>     .Attr("ellipsis_mask: int = 0")
>     .Attr("new_axis_mask: int = 0")
>     .Attr("shrink_axis_mask: int = 0")
>
> And similarly, what is the output data type of such an op?
>
> —
